result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC<0.15) and Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st) (PAC<0.15). The defendant was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC<0.15) and the other charge, Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st) (PAC<0.15) was dismissed by the court.

  • Dakota J. Wood was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC<0.15), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.
  • Dakota J. Wood was found guilty of Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution $3,730.62 at $175 per month payments while on probation - Defendant will have to make arrangments with Court commissioner for a restitutuion hearing, if he disagrees with this amount.
*Per stipulation and order, it is hereby ordered that the JOC be amended to reflect the defendant owes additional restitution in the amount of $42.76.  In all other repects, the JOC is the same as entered by the Court on June 15, 2015.

Pay court costs.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Defendant ordered to have a Mental Health Assessment and to comply with any recommended treatment.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
  Engage and comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
Apology letter to Frederick Lein, give to Agent first.

Defendant Dakota J. Wood in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Dakota J. Wood in custody.  Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Cases heard at this time are 15CF-38 for SAR and 15CF-414 for plea.

9:03 AM Court calls cases.
Matter of 15CF-414 is set for a plea/sentencing hearing this morning.

Atty Cousins states appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Atty Cousins addresses the two files before the Court.
State is prepared to proceed with 15CF-38.

All parties have received the revocation packet.
State recommends 180 days on both counts with days credit.  Costs and restitution to be entered into civil judgment.

15CF-414: Defendant will plead to Count 3 and Count 4.
Count 1 and Count 2 will be dismissed and read in.
Atty Cousins states the plea agreement.

Atty McFarland concurs.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 3 15CF-414
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 4 15CF-414

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney McFarland for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-414 Count 1: Dismissed and Read In for purposes of sentencing
15CF-414 Count 2: Dismissed and Read In for purposes of sentencing
15CF-414 Count 3: Found Guilty
15CF-414 Count 4: Found Guilty

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court.

Atty Cousins reiterates the revocation recommended sentencing, costs and restitution are listed on the first page of the revocation packet.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-38:
Count 1:
Jail sentence of 180 Days, to run concurrent to Wood County Revocation
99 Days Jail Credit
Pay costs 
Pay restitution
Costs and restitution are to be converted to a civil judgment against the Defendant

*****BY THE COURT: 15CF-38: COUNT 1: NOT SUBJECT TO THIS RESENTENCING /s/RJS  2/4/16*****

15CF-38:
Count 3:
Jail sentence of 180 Days, concurrent to Count 1 and concurrent to Wood County Revocation
99 Days Jail Credit 
Pay costs
Pay restitution
Costs and restitution are to be converted to a civil judgment against the Defendant

(Listed on first page of revocation packet)
Costs are $553.34
Restitution is $3,730.62
Victim Witness is $92

Court finds joint recommendation is appropriate. 

15CF-414:
Count 3:
Sentence is Withheld 
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Pay Costs
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge of $100
No Contact, direct or indirect,with N. C.
Seek out, obtain and maintain full time employment
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription 
Required to complete a AODA, as quickly as that can be arranged after being released and ordered to comply with treatment recommendations following the assessment
Comply with any counseling or other treatment recommendations made by agent

15CF-414:
Count 4:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to Count 3
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 3
Pay costs
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge of $100

Defendant Dakota J. Wood appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David R. Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Court questions defendant if he has seen his attorney.
Defendant makes statements.  Will be firing attorney Kuhl. 
Court will not proceed without his current attorney present. 
Atty Knaapen asks to continue the matter to 3:00 or reschedule this for 2 weeks.  
Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant is serving a revocation.  He has 10 days to serve for a Wood County case. 

BY THE COURT:  Court will adjourn for 1 week. 

Defendant questions if he can file for a motion. 
Court advises to speak to Atty Kuhl.
